frame.name: Beat_opponent
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Winner</fen> has victory over an <fen>Loser</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Winner">He</fex> <fex name="Frequency">always</fex> <t>beats</t> <fex name="Loser">me</fex> <fex name="Competition">at chess</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Winner
FE.definition: <def-root>The individual or individuals who beat the <fen>Loser</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Score
FE.definition: <def-root>A quantity whereby progress is measured during the game, and Rank and <fen>Prize</fen>s are awarded to the <fen>Winner</fen> afterward.</def-root>

FE.name: Margin
FE.definition: <def-root>The amount by which the <fen>Winner</fen> 's and <fen>Loser</fen> 's <fen>Score</fen>s differ.</def-root>

FE.name: Rank
FE.definition: <def-root>The rank (according to <fen>Score</fen>) that a <fen>Winner</fen> acheives.</def-root>

FE.name: Prize
FE.definition: <def-root>A socially and/or monetarily significant entity which is given to a <fen>Winner</fen> according to <fen>Score</fen> or <fen>Rank</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An action of the <fen>Winner</fen> or <fen>Loser</fen> that makes the beating event possible.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the <fen>Winner</fen> or <fen>Loser</fen> which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of a <fen>Winner</fen> or <fen>Loser</fen> that also affect their action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>When the <fen>Winner</fen> has victory over the <fen>Loser</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The location where the <fen>Winner</fen> has victory <fen>Loser</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Venue
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE is for the named venue of a competition, particularly when the place has been built for the purpose of a competition.
</def-root>

FE.name: Particular_iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. </def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The reason why the <fen>Winner</fen> has victory over the <fen>Loser</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Period_of_iterations
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when winning events began to be repeated to when they stopped.</def-root>

FE.name: Loser
FE.definition: <def-root>The individual or individuals that get beat by the <fen>Winner</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of the world when the <fen>Winner</fen> beats the <fen>Loser</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Re-encoding
FE.definition: <def-root>The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame expressed by the <fex name="Re-encoding">Re-encoding</fex>, but not necessarily. </def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>The state-of-affairs that prevails as a result of the <fen>Winner</fen> beating the <fen>Loser</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Iterations
FE.definition: <def-root>The frame element <fex name="Iterations">Iterations</fex> is used for expressions that indicate the number of times the <fen>Winner</fen> beats the <fen>Loser</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Communicative_force
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the <fen>Communicative_force</fen> or authority with which the winning event operates (often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.). </def-root>

FE.name: Event_description
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE applies to appraisals of the event, typically a judgment of its expectedness, or a description of the state-of-affairs introduced by the winning event.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>A qualitative measure of how much the <fen>Winner</fen> beat the <fen>Loser</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action.</def-root>

FE.name: Competition
FE.definition: <def-root>The event in which the <fen>Competition</fen> competes.</def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>How often the <fen>Winner</fen> beats the <fen>Loser</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: beat.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: win against in a contest

lexUnit.name: demolish.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: wine a game by a large margin

lexUnit.name: prevail.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: come out as winner in a challenging competition

lexUnit.name: defeat.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an instance of defeating or being defeated

lexUnit.name: trounce.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: defeat heavily in a contest
